item.title: Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 Lets Players Pay to Unlock New Event Weapon Early
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • A Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 store bundle allows players to pay to unlock the new Sirin 9mm SMG.
  • The weapon can also be unlocked via the Hit List event, but 50 billion community eliminations are needed to unlock the SMG.
  • Fans say it is "sad" that the weapon is locked behind a paywall before the event has come to an end.

Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 now allows players to unlock the new Sirin 9mm submachine gun early by purchasing a bundle via the in-game store. The new weapon was supposed to be the final reward in Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 's Hit List event, which sees players band together to unlock new rewards by racking up as many eliminations as possible, but fans have been left miffed by Treyarch's decision to let the community bypass the event and pay to unlock the SMG early.

Treyarch kicked off the new Hit List event in Black Ops 6 and Warzone on November 21 with plenty of rewards up for grabs. Players have until December 5 to unlock a variety of personal and community rewards, with the latter requiring all Black Ops 6 players to band together to reach 50 billion eliminations to unlock the Sirin 9mm SMG. There are plenty of other rewards along the way too, including a new perk, scorestreak, and more. At the time of writing, the community is a long way off from unlocking the new SMG, but that hasn't stopped Treyarch from including the weapon in a new store bundle.

Black Ops 6 Lets Players Pay to Get New Sirin 9mm SMG Early

Players have already managed to unlock the Shadow Perk and Buffer Weight Stock as part of Black Ops 6 's Hit List event, but there are still another 30 billion eliminations required to unlock the Sirin 9mm SMG. But, for those who don't want to wait for the community to unlock the reward, the weapon can now simply be purchased from the Call of Duty store. On November 26, Treyarch released the new Cash Bandit bundle, which includes a variety of cosmetic items and a weapon blueprint for the yet-to-be-released Sirin 9mm SMG. For those unaware, base weapons are permanently unlocked in Black Ops 6 whenever a user owns a blueprint for it, which means the Sirin 9mm can be permanently unlocked before the event milestone is even reached by purchasing the new bundle, which costs 2,800 COD points.

As expected, Black Ops 6 players aren't happy with Treyarch's decision to include the weapon in a store bundle. YouTuber JGOD said it is "sad" to gatekeep the weapon behind a paywall until the event is over, while Nick said that "purposely setting the community event super high so it takes forever to achieve and then paywalling a shortcut is the most scummy thing you can do." Plenty of other players echoed similar comments, with many saying that it "should never" have been included in the bundle.

Unfortunately, this is just the latest controversy surrounding the newest Call of Duty title's microtransactions. Earlier this week, Treyarch released the highly-anticipated Replacer bundle, which allowed fans to play as the popular character used in Black Ops ' marketing videos. But players were quickly disappointed by the new Black Ops 6 bundle after it was revealed that the Blackcell Battle Pass must be purchased to unlock the operator's second variant, meaning the bundle would be double the cost if players wanted to unlock all of its accompanying cosmetics.

item.title: All Friendly Monsters in Dragon Quest 3 Remake (& Where to Find Them)
item.description:
The Monster Arena is one of the most interesting new additions in Dragon Quest 3 Remake. While the original had an arena, the mechanics have been completely changed for the remake. Throughout the game, players will encounter Friendly Monsters that they can catch and recruit for use in the Monster Arena. There, monsters will fight, offering players the chance to win some extremely valuable rewards. Also, every monster you capture will help improve the Monster Wrangler, DQIII Remake 's new vocation. This guide will tell you where to find every Friendly Monster in Dragon Quest 3 Remake, and the rewards you'll get for doing so.

All Friendly Monsters in Dragon Quest 3 Remake

There are so many Friendly Monsters in Dragon Quest 3 Remake, that the only way to truly organize them is by monster type . Every monster type has at least two Friendly Monsters found in the world. For example, Gobblerbert and Antony are both Antgobblers. The first monster you find of each type will be the base, with each additional monster of the same type found acting as upgrades to the base monster.

The list of Friendly Monsters in this guide will be presented alphabetically by monster type, with Antgobbler starting the list. Each monster can have up to three variants, each with its own unique name, like Gobblebert. You can search the document by monster type or name. Remember, not all monsters can be easily caught. Check our guide to catching friendly monsters in Dragon Quest 3 Remake to learn more.

And remember, locations are not tied to specific monster names. If you collect them in the order we did, you'll get the same result. But it is also possible to get a different result if you visit the locations in a different order. If there are four varieties of a single monster type, and four different locations, the first location you visit will always be the base version of that monster. You may have found a monster on the list in a different location, and that's OK. Just make sure to visit every location, and you'll get every monster.

Antgobbler

Monster Name

Location

Special Requirements

Map

Gobblebert

Secret Spot - large tree in the valley between Romaria and Khoryv

N/A

Antony

Underground Lake - B2, just before exiting to B3

Some enemies are only available at certain times of day. Check out our guide to changing time of day in Dragon Quest 3 Remake .

Craggy Caves - B2 - NW

N/A

item.title: Avowed Could Be Following in Baldur’s Gate 3’s Footsteps with One Feature
item.description:
Even though it's a spin-off of the Pillars of Eternity series, Avowed 's initial showing at the Xbox Games Showcase 2020 drew a lot of comparisons to The Elder Scrolls 5: Skyrim . The dark fantasy tone, dull color palette, first-person perspective, and spell-casting combat displayed in the game's reveal trailer were starkly reminiscent of the seminal Bethesda RPG. Because of this, many assumed that Avowed would be similar to The Elder Scrolls in terms of gameplay and scope. It was, after all, being developed by Obsidian Entertainment, a company that already had experience creating Bethesda-style games like Fallout: New Vegas .

While Obsidian did initially conceive Avowed as a Skyrim successor, it eventually evolved into something else throughout the course of its development. The game still has all the bells and whistles one would expect from a AAA RPG, but it's more restrained in scope compared to something like Skyrim or Fallout: New Vegas . Contrary to what some fans expected, Avowed is not open-world, nor does it have dozens of companions to romance or an endless amount of side quests to complete. Instead, it's more of a hub-based RPG, akin to one of Obsidian's previous titles, The Outer Worlds . Avowed 's modest scope may lead some to think that it doesn't have a lot of optional content, unlike recent games such as Baldur's Gate 3 , but according to some statements from a developer at Obsidian, that isn't the case.

Avowed Approaches Missable Content a Lot Like Baldur's Gate 3 Does

Both Avowed and Baldur's Gate 3 Have a Sizable Amount of Content that Players Can Miss

In a recent interview with GamesRadar+, senior area designer Bergo Ritger revealed that Obsidian placed a major emphasis on creating missable content when developing Avowed . The company did this in order to make playthroughs of the game feel more personalized. With this approach, Obsidian aimed to draw players' attention to different locations and activities and, as such, incite discussions among them about what they skipped. Having missable content in Avowed was necessary because, according to Ritger, it's "the core of RPGs that makes them special."

Avowed 's design philosophy seems to share a lot in common with that of Baldur's Gate 3 , the wildly successful Dungeons & Dragons RPG that came out in 2023. For those who don't know, BG3 is filled to the brim with optional content, the majority of which is missable. In fact, even though its main story only lasts for around 70 hours, it takes more than double that time to complete everything in the RPG. Since Baldur's Gate 3 's gameplay and plot are driven by choice and consequence, gamers will need to play through it multiple times in order to experience everything it has to offer.

Missable Content in Video Games Has Some Pros and Cons

If Avowed is anything like Baldur's Gate 3 in this regard, then that means it'll be highly replayable and will feature a large amount of missable content for gamers to enjoy. For some, this is great news. When games make activities inaccessible to those who haven't completed certain side quests or story paths, it makes players' choices feel more meaningful. If everything is accessible to all players from the get-go, no matter what they do, then going through a game multiple times is kind of pointless.

That being said, some players may prefer RPGs that have fewer branching paths. A lot of gamers don't have the time to commit hundreds upon hundreds of hours to a single video game, especially considering all the high-quality titles being released these days. As such, having the ability to experience most or all of an RPG's content in one playthrough may be ideal from their perspective. Players like these are probably not going to be fans of Obsidian's approach to optional content in Avowed , but those that do enjoy choice-and-consequence in RPGs may end up loving the game.

item.title: The Last of Us Part 1 Gets New Update for November 2024
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • The Last of Us Part 1 patch 2.0.2 on PS5 fixes combat crashes & visual issues.
  • The update solved a crash that would occur when killing enemies with any weapon and an issue where visuals appeared sharper than intended.
  • In response to the hotfix, fans wanted to know when the Factions multiplayer would be ported into the remake.

Naughty Dog has recently released a new update for The Last of Us Part 1 in patch 2.0.2, which fixes a few issues hindering PlayStation 5 players’ gameplay. The Last of Us Part 1 ’s last patch arrived in October 2024, which combated a handful of problems occurring in photo mode, adjusted the Fidelity display, and applied small fixes to the audio mix and lighting during a later chapter in the game.

Released in 2022, The Last of Us Part 1 launched as a remake of the 2013 game of the same name, enhancing combat and exploration with revised gameplay mechanics and expanded accessibility options. The Last of Us Part 1 and The Last of Us Part 2 Remastered recently received a PS5 Pro update, which adjusted both games to the new console’s system and fixed a few bugs alongside enhancing the accessibility.

Launched on November 26 and available to download now, patch 2.0.2 is a minor update addressing only two issues found in The Last of Us Part 1 . The first fix solved a crash that would sometimes occur during players’ playthrough when killing an enemy with any weapon. Despite the game’s stunning graphics, with the impressive visuals recently showcased by The Last of Us Part 1 cinematographer, the patch also fixed an issue with the images’ quality. Gamers reported experiencing in-game visuals that appeared sharper than intended, but the developer has now adjusted this anomaly for PS5 players.

Naughty Dog Releases The Last of Us Part 1 Patch 2.0.2

Bugs are commonplace in every game, including one The Last of Us Part 1 bug that saw enemies forgetting they were infected. However, Naughty Dog regularly irons out these issues to make the standout game seamless, and these updates should only be released in the future to catch any rogue bugs that manifest. In response on Twitter, some players were quick to point out that the issues highlighted in patch 2.0.2 also occurred in The Last of Us Part 2 Remastered , in addition to a rendering hitch where some textures didn’t load properly. Furthermore, a few PC players highlighted some bugs still plaguing the PC port.

The Last of Us community generally received the hotfix warmly, but the developer’s Twitter post was soon flooded with fans asking for the original game’s online Factions multiplayer to be patched into the remake. On a different note, the fandom is all ears when it comes to rumors circling a potential third game in the post-apocalyptic series, including the recently debunked tease that seemed to reveal Naughty Dog’s new IP.

item.title: League of Legends: Jinx Fixes Everything Act 3 Walkthrough
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Jinx Fixes Everything Rewards In League Of Legends
  • Upgrade The Power Source In Jinx Fixes Everything Act 3
  • Make A Cooling System In Jinx Fixes Everything Act 3
  • Fixing The Pipes & The Ending In Jinx Fixes Everything Act 3

Act 3 of Jinx Fixes Everything is the final stage of the Arcane- themed mini-game in the League of Legends client, and the most important, as this is how to get the free Singed skin .

The aim of Act 3 is to upgrade Jinx's gun in order to save Piltover & Zaun from the Noxian army and Viktor. It takes place during Season 2, Episode 9 of Arcane , just after Ekko saves Jinx and convinces her to fight. The mini-game takes place at the Firelight's hideout .

Jinx Fixes Everything Rewards In League Of Legends

  • Act 1: Blue Essence
  • Act 2: Blue Essence
  • Act 3: Arcane Shimmer Lab Singed skin

The most exciting reward for Jinx Fixes Everything is naturally the Arcane Singed skin , similar to the free Arcane skins given away during Season 1.

To get this skin, players will need to complete all three Acts, as the latter ones are only unlocked by completing the previous Acts.

Upgrade The Power Source In Jinx Fixes Everything Act 3

After placing Jinx's gun on the workbench, players should turn left toward the power source. After pulling the lever down, the rest is a pattern memory game . Simply wait for the green buttons to light up, and when done, press them in the exact same order .

The pattern will be different for each player , so there's no preset to follow. It gets progressively harder, capping out six buttons to click.

Make A Cooling System In Jinx Fixes Everything Act 3

Next on Jinx's to-do list is to make a state-of-the-art cooling system , which could be used to run the best graphical games if she didn't need to save an entire city.

Pick up the fan opposite the workbench , and then head back to assemble the gun. If you ever struggle to find things in Jinx Fixes Everything , look for her iconic spray paint signs .

Unfortunately, after adding the fan, Jinx's trial run won't work, as one more piece is needed .

Fixing The Pipes & The Ending In Jinx Fixes Everything Act 3

Next, players will want to head over to the pipes , and attempt to shift the airflow. This is done by pressing the red levers in the following order:

  • Middle bottom.
  • Top right.
  • Bottom Left.
  • Top Left.

This will free a piece of pipe which Jinx can then add to her gun. Take it to the workbench , and Jinx will complete and name her new gun Rhino.

With that done, Jinx Fixes Everything is practically at an end. Players can walk around and look at Arcane Easter eggs, and when they are finihsed head outside and down the stairs to the mural. A cutscene will trigger and with that, the Arcane Shimmer Lab Singed skin will be unlocked . Players will find it in their skin collection.
